subject: Travel
title: Sacred Cows of India
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sacred Cows of India.

hook.text: In India, cows roam freely through city streets and nobody moves them. Cars and buses drive around them.

buildup.text: Hinduism considers the cow a sacred symbol of life and motherhood. Harming one is deeply taboo.

discovery.text: Many Indian states ban cow slaughter entirely. Violating the law can mean years in prison.

twist.text: India has the largest cattle population on Earth but is also one of the top beef exporters â€” from water buffalo.

climax.text: Cow shelters called gaushalas care for old and sick cows. Some are funded by the government.

punchline.text: India protects its cows while the world finds it puzzling.

quiz.question: Why do cows roam freely in Indian cities?
